member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified object.

member.summary: Gets the hash code of the vector object.

member.summary: Calculates the length of the vector.

member.summary: Calculates the length of the vector squared.

member.summary: Calculates the distance between two vectors.

member.summary: Calculates the distance between two vectors.

member.summary: Calculates the distance between two vectors squared.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Dot(SFML.Graphics.Vector3,SFML.Graphics.Vector3)
member.summary: Calculates the dot product of two vectors. If the two vectors are unit vectors, the dot product returns a floating point value between -1 and 1 that can be used to determine some properties of the angle between two vectors. For example, it can show whether the vectors are orthogonal, parallel, or have an acute or obtuse angle between them.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Dot(SFML.Graphics.Vector3@,SFML.Graphics.Vector3@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates the dot product of two vectors and writes the result to a user-specified variable. If the two vectors are unit vectors, the dot product returns a floating point value between -1 and 1 that can be used to determine some properties of the angle between two vectors. For example, it can show whether the vectors are orthogonal, parallel, or have an acute or obtuse angle between them.
member.param: [OutAttribute] The dot product of the two vectors.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Normalize
member.summary: Turns the current vector into a unit vector. The result is a vector one unit in length pointing in the same direction as the original vector.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Normalize(SFML.Graphics.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a unit vector from the specified vector. The result is a vector one unit in length pointing in the same direction as the original vector.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Normalize(SFML.Graphics.Vector3@,SFML.Graphics.Vector3@)
member.summary: Creates a unit vector from the specified vector, writing the result to a user-specified variable. The result is a vector one unit in length pointing in the same direction as the original vector.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Cross(SFML.Graphics.Vector3,SFML.Graphics.Vector3)
member.summary: Calculates the cross product of two vectors.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Cross(SFML.Graphics.Vector3@,SFML.Graphics.Vector3@,SFML.Graphics.Vector3@)
member.summary: Calculates the cross product of two vectors.
member.param: [OutAttribute] The cross product of the vectors.

member.summary: Returns the reflection of a vector off a surface that has the specified normal. Reference page contains code sample.

member.summary: Performs a linear interpolation between two vectors.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Barycentric(SFML.Graphics.Vector3,SFML.Graphics.Vector3,SFML.Graphics.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a Vector3 containing the 3D Cartesian coordinates of a point specified in Barycentric coordinates relative to a 3D triangle.
member.param: A Vector3 containing the 3D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 1 of the triangle.
A Vector3 containing the 3D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 2 of the triangle.
A Vector3 containing the 3D Cartesian coordinates of vertex 3 of the triangle.
Barycentric coordinate b2, which expresses the weighting factor toward vertex 2 (specified in value2).
Barycentric coordinate b3, which expresses the weighting factor toward vertex 3 (specified in value3).

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.Vector3.Barycentric(SFML.Graphics.Vector3@,SFML.Graphics.Vector3@,SFML.Graphics.Vector3@,System.Single,System.Single,SFML.Graphics.Vector3@)
member.summary: Returns a Vector3 containing the 3D Cartesian coordinates of a point specified in barycentric (areal) coordinates relative to a 3D triangle.

member.summary: Calculates the dot product of two vectors. If the two vectors are unit vectors, the dot product returns a floating point value between -1 and 1 that can be used to determine some properties of the angle between two vectors. For example, it can show whether the vectors are orthogonal, parallel, or have an acute or obtuse angle between them.

member.param: [OutAttribute] The dot product of the two vectors.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.BoundingSphere.Transform(SFML.Graphics.Matrix)
member.summary: Translates and scales the BoundingSphere using a given Matrix.
member.param: A transformation matrix that might include translation, rotation, or uniform scaling. Note that BoundingSphere.Transform will not return correct results if there are non-uniform scaling, shears, or other unusual transforms in this transformation matrix. This is because there is no way to shear or non-uniformly scale a sphere. Such an operation would cause the sphere to lose its shape as a sphere.

member.name: M:SFML.Graphics.BoundingSphere.Transform(SFML.Graphics.Matrix@,SFML.Graphics.BoundingSphere@)
member.summary: Translates and scales the BoundingSphere using a given Matrix.
member.param: A transformation matrix that might include translation, rotation, or uniform scaling. Note that BoundingSphere.Transform will not return correct results if there are non-uniform scaling, shears, or other unusual transforms in this transformation matrix. This is because there is no way to shear or non-uniformly scale a sphere. Such an operation would cause the sphere to lose its shape as a sphere.
